quotes.quote: Did you ever observe that immoderate laughter always ends in a sigh?
A sigh is an amplifier for people who suffer in silence.
Humour allows people to exhale a little.
Many persons sigh for death when it seems far off, but the inclination vanishes when the boat upsets, or the locomotive runs off the track, or the measles set it.
Sighs and silences and avoided conversations are just as important as the things you do talk about.
Open your mouth wide a universal sigh.
When I hear somebody sigh, 'Life is hard,' I am always tempted to ask, 'Compared to what?
There is a chord in every heart that has a sigh in it if touched aright.
Words may be false and full of art; Sighs are the natural language of the heart.
If you begin the day with a laugh, you may, nevertheless, end it with a sob and a sigh.
A woman can say more in a sigh than a man can say in a sermon.
That sort of half sigh, which, accompanied by two or three slight nods of the head, is pity's small change in general society.
The drama of life begins with a wail and ends with a sigh.
The human heart has a sigh lonelier than the cry of the bittern.
All the world knows how to cry but not all the world knows how to sigh. Sighing is extra.
A sigh isn't just a sigh. We inhale the world and breathe out meaning. While we can. While we can.
Occasionally we sigh for an earlier day when we could just look at the stars without worrying whether they were theirs or ours.
Novels teach the youthful mind to sigh after happiness that never existed.
We make too much of that long groan which underlines the past.
A sigh can shatter a castle in the air.
A laugh is the loud echo of a sigh; a sigh the faint echo of a laugh.
Life is like a story, when all the resolution is resolved, you heave a sigh of relief.
